atk-s0403a12:0_0: (The sick should be expanded like this:)
atk-s0403a12:1_0: Second: Long Worthy of Offerings Dedicated to the Gods
atk-s0403a12:2_2: I expect that more cloth for the sake of material benefits.
atk-s0403a12:3_0: Declaring this terrify of gold coins and bullion.
atk-s0403a12:4_0: Right away, there is no sixth life, and the sixth lost life.
atk-s0403a12:6_1: We’re not able to stay in the Saṅgha’s dwelling apart from the Saṅgha’s dwelling; they don’t stay in one part of the Saṅgha.
atk-s0403a12:6_2: If she does not stay in the midst of the Sangha, even for a hundred years, because she thinks, “Not in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a schism, she doesn’t be able to leave of the Sangha.
atk-s0403a12:6_3: It’s enough for us to stay apart from the Saṅgha of the four quarters and also to stay in the Saṅgha of the mendicants.
atk-s0403a12:6_4: The eighth section on the meaning.
atk-s0403a12:8_3: Putting over the past, frequented by beasts of pastries.
atk-s0403a12:9_0: The third sub-chapter on sick is finished.
